instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.U7201: What is U7201? U7201 is responsible for the 3.3v and 5v power rails on many devices..
definitions.R5281: What is R5281? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issues
threads.message:
Here's another fun one. <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A board this board had been brought in for beer spill. i get green light on charger but only had 1.7v on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.Looked to be a problem with <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>, i changed it out and got 12v back on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>. Plugged a battery in smelled something smoking, unplugged everything and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is back to 1.5v. 

Something seems to be shorting out the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> when a battery is plugged in. i measured for short to ground on <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR>, pin 5 gives me an 0L reading. checked for resistance on pin 5 with 0L still.

not really sure where to go with this one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issues
threads.message: Need more info, a short on <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR> does not tell me anything, how many pins does it have? The machine should have powered on without a battery too. I bet there is a short on PPBUS

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issues
threads.message: <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR> has 8 pins 4 of which are input from battery as <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H</SIGNAL>. machine did not power up when connected to 85w charger. i show .427 in diode mode on F7040. But i just noticed that after i unplug the charger in diode mode it starts at -1.6 then goes to 0.427. so probably a weak short?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issues
threads.message: That is just capacitors on PPBUS discharging.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issues
threads.message: thats what i was thinking too. i did some poking around to find <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> at 3.3v. I'm missing a bunch of power rails. it doesn't get warm anywhere on the board so not sure what would be causing this.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issues
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issues
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is at 12.28v after i changed the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> out for the second time. don't really want to plug in the battery and blow another <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> chip.

i noticed u7600pin 13 is at 0.012v with no short to ground.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issues
threads.message:
12.28V is no good anyway, either SMC not running or SMC is dead. I bet dead SMC and dead battery.
Short on pin 13 is also no good, remove <RESISTOR>R7601</RESISTOR> and check which side the short is coming from.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issues
threads.message: i have no way of check the battery really. but i checked and in diode mode on pin 13 of <CHIP>U7600</CHIP> i get 0.374. maybe something went crazy and shorted some of the smc out. seems like i tend to get a lot of bad smc's. is that pretty common for water damaged machines?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issues
threads.message: Common on liquid damage and stuff that has been/is being fucked around with. If you have a green/orange light it should still power on though

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issues
threads.message: yea i agree with you, I'm not questioning you... just new to this and not that great at reading the schematics yet. Sorry for the inconvenience.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issues
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issues
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issues
threads.message: Come one, engage your brain.......Voltage on PPBUS, <RESISTOR>R7940</RESISTOR> and check short to GND on L7260. Green/orange light present?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issues
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 12.28v. <RESISTOR>R7940</RESISTOR> 0.001v. in diode mode 0.5551.  L7260 has a low diode mode measurement of 0.130. Yes i have a green light on the charger. i checked <CHIP>U7201</CHIP> and it is receiving the 12.28v on vin but nothing on the enable signals.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issues
threads.message: Looks like at least a bad SMC to me.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issues
threads.message:
found short to ground on pin 2 of <DIODE>D6950</DIODE>, tracked back to pin2 of <RESISTOR>R5281</RESISTOR>, removed <RESISTOR>R5281</RESISTOR> and found short to ground on the pad going to the smc. I also found there to be a short on pin 1 of <RESISTOR>R5281</RESISTOR> which i traced back to pin 1 of <RESISTOR>R6995</RESISTOR>. still not sure how this resistor could have a short to ground being that i removed <CHIP>U6990</CHIP> to make sure it wasnt the problem. still dont understand how i had a green light with a short on pp3v42.

i dont have a replacement smc for this board. Thanks for all your help Duke.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power issues
threads.message: No idea, inject voltage and see if SMC heats up. Pretty sure it will be dead, you will need a donor board.
